head.supplied: Commercial Hotel ¶ Woodend ¶ April 30 ¶ 18 ¶ 73 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I respectfully make application on behalf of the Trustees of the Woodend Cemetry for grant of shrubs for the Cemetry at Woodend and should ...

div.p: I73/9276, unit 750, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: See M to J. J. Casey, 22 May 1873 (in this edition as 73-05-22i).

div.p:
I respectfully make application on behalf of the Trustees of the Woodend Cemetry for grant of shrubs for the Cemetry at Woodend and should you grant the request should feel obliged by your giving us 21 oaks and 6 English ashes and the remainder Petosporones
i.e. Pittosporums. & Lauristinus or whatever Evergreens you can spare best. I bought good many pines last year and think we shall not require any more pines or oaks and if you could give us about 200 Plants altogether encluding the oaks and ashes should feel obliged and will send the empty pots down from last year when sending down
